settings.heading: How do I download and install the Arcademi app?
settings.desc: Visit the App Store (iOS) or Google Play Store (Android), search for "Arcademi," and follow the on-screen instructions to download and install.

settings.heading: What devices are compatible with Arcademi?
settings.desc: Arcademi is compatible with most modern iOS and Android devices. Ensure your device meets the minimum system requirements for optimal performance.

settings.heading: Where can I find information on compatible devices?
settings.desc:
The full list of iOS and Android devises that have augmented reality capability:

https://developers.google.com/ar/devices

settings.heading: I can't scan AR flashcards. What could be the problem?
settings.desc: Make sure your device's camera is functioning correctly and that there is sufficient lighting. If the background is too bright (e.g. white table) this can make it difficult for the camera to scan the card image. Clean the camera lens, and ensure you are holding the device steady while scanning.

settings.heading: Why am I not receiving push notifications from Arcademi?
settings.desc: Check your device settings to ensure notifications are enabled for the Arcademi app.

settings.heading: The app is slow or unresponsive. What can I do?
settings.desc:
Close other running apps, clear cache (if applicable), and ensure your device has sufficient storage space. Consider updating to the latest version of the app.



For additional assistance or specific issues, contact our support team at support@arcademi.io

settings.heading: Can I use Arcademi without an internet connection?
settings.desc: Yes, you can access previously downloaded content without an internet connection. However, an internet connection is required to download new topics and updates.

settings.heading: The app is crashing. What should I do?
settings.desc: Ensure your app is updated to the latest version. If the issue persists, try restarting your device or reinstalling the app.
